-e ---

V2 𓍬 CUT / WND wind / 𓍢𓏏 wound++ 𓍬𓏏𓐎 w-g-b

𓋴 𓍬 #sTA

𓋴 𓍬 𓄿 𓏲 | injury | Stauchung щета šteta strain
𓋴 𓍬 𓍿 𓄿 𓂻 | flow | strömen Strom
𓋴 𓍬 𓍿 𓄿 𓂻 | flow | escoar es-coar ex-coar

𓋴 𓐍 𓏏 𓌦 | weave | сучи́ть sučítʹ < сотка́ть sotkátʹ kusokota > kutoja ткать … kehrätä ketrama
𓋴 𓍿 𓍬 | weave, spin (yarn) | •[ה]]•stoweb > הסתובב histovév
𓋴 𓍿 𓍬 | weave, spin (yarn) | сотка́ть sotkátʹ ⇔ stecken sticken stricken

𓍬 ᴷWRK,ᴷWND < 𓏲 WR/WN

վերք vɛɾkʰ = (flesh)wound 𓍢𓏏

(flesh) wound:
жаракат carakat 𓍬𓏏 cut 𓍬 *(s)ker “to cut” жара cara
керявкс kerjavks جرح gurḥ yara жара jara жарақат jaraqat იარი iɑri hurt?
ахəра ɑχərɑ суран suran чов t͡ʃɔ͡ʊ сэредькс seredʹks Scheren churn sár scar
ჭრილობა č̣riloba घाव ghāv gab créacht 𓍬𓏏 crack жаракат ⇔ through-cut?

because of the clear winding/half-circular picture of 𓍬/𓍢𓏏, one can connect
the otherwise unrelated roots 𓍬 *(s)ker cut and *(s)ker- “to bend, curve, turn” ⇔ curve circle

𓃉 𓋪 κίρκος kírkos, “circle, ring” cyclos 𓍶 κρίκος kríkos, “ring” (ri/ri swap)
𓃉 𓋪 Kreis *krītaną “to scratch; carve”

There seems to be a deep connection between curve and carve.

𓊌𓏤 stadion/staton(areand)/setat 𓍬𓏏𓏏 ⇔ Stätte
setat 𓍬𓏏𓏏 one square khet, or 10,000 square cubit (cent*cent 100²) 2/3 acres
